item.description:
Based on Illusteret Videnskab's mobile game of the same name, players compete against each other while answering questions in six different categories: Sports & leisure, history, entertainment, geography, science & nature and arts & literature.

While doing so, players have an option to get additional advantages by placing their tiles strategically.

The first player to get rid of all tiles is declared the winner.

name.value: Yukimura's Last Battle: Osaka Siege Summer Campaign
ユキムラズ・ラスト・バトル 大坂夏の陣

item.description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #24.

An operational level wargame of the battle of Tennoji, climax of the Osaka Siege Summer Campaign.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Osaka
Yukimura Sanada was the dominating army leader in the Toyotomi army, and he was killed in this battle.

Players control either the Tokugawa army or the Toyotomi army. Each army has an initial morale level at three, and they can perform the operations of the same number as the morale level.
Toyotomi army has only one formation and they can perform either movement or combat in an operation. Tokugawa army has six formations and a formation can move and combat in an operation.

Winner is determined by the collapse of morale or breaking through the front line.

Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #25.

Operational level wargame for battle of Okehazama.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okehazama
Actually, this game is covering Owariã€€invasion by Imagawa Yoshimoto, and mostly battle may not occur at Okehazama area. The basic game engine use from Jimbo's Nagashino Shitaragahara.

Player control either Oda clan or Imagawa clan. In each turn, player play one of two cards for unit movement or given event.

Winner is determined by victory points or removal of the opponent daimyo(lord). However, Imagawa clan must advance his daimyo to Owari province.

In Ghost Hunter: Vampires players become Infernal Club investigators. In their latest adventure they have uncovered the worldwide phenomenon of vampirism. Now they risk their necks (literally) to become the best vampire hunters and end the curse.

Ghost Hunter: Vampires is a card game for 2-6 players that should last for 10 – 20 minutes. Players take turns to lay higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on a stack then they must pick up the stack. If a player lays a set or run of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. Many of the cards that can be laid have addition rules that affect the game, for instance'the next player misses ago' or 'capture the top 3 cards from an opponent's capture pile, it is using these special rules at the right time that is the real skill of the game. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game. Players count up the scores of all of the cards they have captured minus all of the cards they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Although Ghost Hunter: Vampires is a stand alone game, it is compatible with other Ghost Hunter decks, allowing players to combine decks or just play with their favorite cards from any deck.

Musikquizzen is based on a Danish radio program of the same name. it is a trivia game, where players have to answer questions about music. There is more than 2000 questions in the game, all of them written by the host of the radio program, Kenneth K.

Test your dexterity! Stack the dishes on the waiter's hands but don't be the one to tip him over!

1 or more players:
Each game piece is assigned a point value:

Big Bowls 2pts
Small Plates 1pt
Small Bowls 2pts
Bottles 3pts

Each player takes a turn trying to stack as many dishes as possible onto the waiters hands. Once the waiter tips, their turn is over. After everyone has taken a turn, the score is tallied up. The player with the highest score wins. Or play against yourself and see how high your stack and score can get.

2 players:
Take turns stacking one dish onto the waiter. The person who tips the waiter loses the game.

Combine soccer and shogi in one game.

In this game, both players need to control a team, 6 players token, and let them shoot the ball to another player's goal. Once you shoot the ball to the goal, you will get one point. The player who get two point win the game.

In your turn, you can choose 1 action from below 2 actions "twice".
1. Move a active player (no matter it's take the ball or not)
2. Pass (or shoot) the ball
You can move the same player in one turn.

In this game, player moving is special. Besides moving to adjacent empty space, you can, just like Chinese checkers, let player jump over another player any times.

The flat magnetic marbles game. Set includes instructions for 10 different games. Contains: 1 Rat Fink magnetic board, 2 Thwacks for tossing the marbles and 12 flat magnetic marbles called Thwarbles. Instructions for assorted target games are included.

Tourni Thwarbles - Toss the thwarbles. The object of the game is to collect the most Thwarbles™ by touching or landing on previously tossed pieces.

Pick off ThWack! - Players place nine Thwarbles onto the board with one in the center and eight along the edges on small ThWack! dots. The Thwacks! on the edge can be placed in a position where they extend partially over the edge to increase difficulty. Players toss their ThWack! attempting to land it on a Thwarble. If successful, the player removes that Thwarble from the board. Play continues until all pieces have been removed. The player with the most Thwarbles at the end wins.

ThWack! ThWarbles - Players pitch and stick their ThWarbles to the board attempting to hit target areas.

RatFink Fly Swat - Players toss ThWarbles to tag ten fly images on the board. Whichever player manages to cover the most flies with his or her ThWarble wins.

Rotation - Players lay out four to six ThWarbles in a clock-like pattern or "rack" around the edges of the board. Players then call which ThWarble they will hit. If they miss, it's the other player's turn. If they hit, they call another ThWarble, continuing until they miss. Winner completes the pattern first.

Chip Shot - One player begins by tossing a ThWarble onto the board, which represents a golf hole. The players attempt to tag that piece in the fewest number of shots. The player who takes the fewest number of throws or "strokes" to hit either 9 or 18 "holes", wins.

Thwack 'Em - Four Thwarbles are placed on the board. Players pitch a thwarble trying to cover one on the board with his own thwarble. (If so he removes both thwarbles.) Player with the most thwarbles wins.

ThWack! ThWarbles 2 - Players determine how many rounds they will play, how many ThWarbles each player will toss out to start each round, and the distance that each player must toss from. Players see who can toss their Thwarbles closest to the edge without them falling off. Player who lands the most thwarbles closest to the edge wins.

name.value: Het grote kat en hond spel

item.description:
In this game, the cats and dogs of the neighbourhood are trying to get home again from their nightly adventures. On your way home, you'll find obstacles like trash cans, traffic lights, ambulances and more. Sometimes you land on a question mark. A question (about cats and dogs) is asked and if you answer correctly, you get to move again!

The game was given away as promo item with Felix, Bonzo and Miauw cat/dog food in The Netherlands.

name.value: ATS Core Module: All American I – Capture of the La Fiere Bridge 1944

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

All American 1 - The Capture of La Fiere 1944: A brand new take on the battle at La Fiere, the ultimate small-unit struggle, a microcosm of a much larger battle. In addition to the Amercan airborne soldier, the star of the battle is the bocage country located along the Merderet River between Ste. Mere Eglise and the UTAH Beach exits. Securing the battlefield on D-Day 1944 was the responsbility of the 82nd Airborne Division, an elite unit with the drop into Sicily already recorded in the annals of airborne warfare the year before.

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

Win points by answering the question correctly on the level of your choice and earn more by guessing the other players’ success.

Contains fascinating questions about European countries and cultures. Decide how many hints you need and bet whether your opponents know the right answer or not. Remember, that wrong bet can lead to losing precious points.

Comes in a handy, compact size!

Can be used as an extension of the original game or as a stand-alone game!

From the publisher's website:

Try to complete silly challenges and bet on how well the other players do! The player with the most game money at the end of the game wins.
Full of funny challenges for grown-ups!
The extensive content makes the game durable and varied.
The betting element takes the game to a new level.

Air Raid - Pearl Harbor! is a detailed simulation and study of an iconic event in U.S. and, indeed, world history. It is an extensively researched wargame inspired by the nearly life-long interest of the designer in the subject matter. Units are individual ships and also individual aircraft, although these are amalgamated into various counters by aircraft type. There is area movement for some portions of the map, and the areas of particular interest are modeled using 250-yard-wide hexes. The simulation is detailed but not overly complex and includes various subsystems to render results for air-to-air, air-to-ground/ship, anti-aircraft, and also anti-submarine operations, to engage any full-size and/or midget Japanese submarines brought into action.

The initial scenario may be played by two players, although it is designed to be a solitaire introduction to the system and also a way to let players experience and study this historic battle, to give insight into much of what happened and why. The likelihood is that you will achieve the historical result, a Japanese Tactical Victory. The standard scenario presents all of the forces available to both sides and allows the Japanese player to modify his or her deployment and attack plans up to and including the composition of the two attack waves. If you think you can plan a more successful attack than Minoru Genda did, you have here the tools to try. Conversely, the U.S. player has the opportunity to fight back to the best of his or her ability, and various optional rules - particularly variations in the initial Alert Level - give the U.S. player more assets with which to fight and more assets to save through evacuation.

There is also a scenario which has one or two American aircraft carriers in port and your initial thought is probably that this is a huge bonus toward Strategic Victory for the Japanese. However, the main Japanese player dilemma of this simulation is that the Japanese have a finite amount of aircraft and ordnance, and more targets are not necessarily a guarantee of victory. You will find that you need to target appropriately and generally roll for damage well in order to successfully hit everything you need to hit. The options allowing a third strike later in the day or the next day are a gamble - you can strike again, but at a fully alerted, albeit weakened, set of targets and you risk losing more aircraft, which equal Victory Points for the U.S.

name.value: Dolfje Weerwolfje: Dolle Volle Maan Kaartspel

item.description:
Card game starring "Dolfje Weerwolfje" werewolf kid hero from children's books.

Variant of Uno. There are cards that can only played when the moon is out, cards that can only be played during daylight, and cards that turn the day to night (or night to day).
In addition, some cards have special effects e.g. change the direction in which is played.

The first player to discard all of his cards, wins the game!

You will be building and improving your robot as you explore custom spaceships looking for scrap.
Best scrapper wins!

The Game:
Players start out with a basic robot that they then are able to upgrade.

Three rounds are played in each round the player can:
1. Sell items from scrapping or old robot parts.
2. Buy parts and upgrade their robot.
3. Scrap a new ship.

Ships are designed by one of the players using the ship cards in the deck and explored with robot shaped pawns. Movement on the ship is based on the robot built, up grade the robot for better movement.

How much scrap or the ability to fight off an alien is based on the level of the robot. Upgrade the robot to not lose in a fight and to bring more treasure home!

The ship has events that happen so staying too long on a ship could cost you your scrap or part of your robot!

To Win:
Players will sell all their scrap and the robots they have built and the player with the most amount of money at the end of the game wins!

Set comes with poker sized playing cards, money and pawns.

A Trail Making Scavenger Hunting Card Game

Trail is a new card game for up to 4 players. You will place cards to get to goals and place cards to block other players from getting to their goals.

The board is always changing!

First one to reach all goals and get back to their start block wins!

A Trail & Word Making Scavenger Hunting Card Game

Trail Words is a new card game for up to 4 players. You will place cards to get to goals and place cards to block other players from getting to their goals. Combine with the Trail card game for 8 players and more fun!

The board is always changing!

First one to reach all goals and get back to their start block wins!

The game is comprised of seven sets of nine cards. Each set of the same colour includes five positive point cards (10 through 50), three negative point cards (-10 through -30) and one wild card (the joker). Each set contains images taken from a Tintin book (Coke en Stock, Le Crabe aux pinces d’or, Tintin au pays de l’or noir, Le Sceptre d’Ottokar, Le Secret de La Licorne, Le Temple du Soleil, and Tintin au Tibet).

'Tintin Joker' is a simple Rummy variant. The goal—collecting sets with as many positive points as one can at the end of each game while giving the maximum number of negative cards to your opponents. The first player to go out achieves a bonus.

link.value: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

item.description:
The concept: Players compete for associate, bachelor's, master's and, finally, doctoral degrees in Bolognabalogical Science by advancing the pawns around a game board depicting the campus of Baloney State University. Each "student" rolls a die to collect vowels and consonants to make up a word with a nonsensical definition. Pawns are advanced by the forming of nonsense words with nonsense definitions from two sets of drawing cards-one for vowels, one for consonants (example: "hinduey: The saggy seat of a loosely worn pair of denim trousers"). Once a player's opponents have accepted a nonsense word and its definition, the player moves his game pawn one space for every letter in the word. Wild-card "Report Cards" add an element of chance (example: "You were caught engaging in the latest campus fad-mud puddle mopping-Report to the Dean`s Office-Don`t Roll!")

The game comes with a board, pawns and die, plus a Baloney State University Student Handbook and a student newspaper, Tall Tales. The handbook provides photographs of the mock school's faculty. Sal Monilla is the cafeteria chef.

El desafío del dragón is a game where you have to travel a dungeon with the danger of being pushed by the dragon into the abyss.
Will you arrive at your castle before the others? 
Using a spinner, you have to move your knight to your tower.

Spanish description:
Un juego en el que tendrás que recorrer una mazmorra con el peligro de ser empujado por el dragón al abismo ¿Lograrás llegar a tu castillo antes que el resto? Estamos ante un juego mecánico en el que mediante una ruleta tendremos que hacer llegar a la torre a nuestro caballero.

Get ready to unleash your turtle power in this Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle (TMNT) version of UNO, dudes! Classic UNO rules apply, yet with the addition of a special rule and four corresponding action cards, players get the chance to experience all new game changing moments! This fearsome foursome of turtles works together with the Team Attack Card, which allows players to vanquish three villains from their hand! Fans of the cartoon series and movie will recognize their favorite characters, like Leonardo and Michelangelo, who are featured on the cards they play. And do not forget to yell "UNO" when you have but one card remaining!

Description from the publisher:

In Liguria, players take the role of merchants who sail the Ligurian Sea to discover beautiful and exotic colors. By trading, conquering and engaging in diplomatic relationships, they can earn valuable prestige points. Fulfilling contracts with the bishop can prove very lucrative...

Make sure to collect all special colors in the various harbors and bring them back home to make your cathedral stand out the most.

Liguria is a prequel to the award-winning game Fresco. As a standalone game, it tells the story of how the colors came to the markets of the Ligurian cities to paint the beautiful frescos.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Do you find it hard to play memory games where you have to find two tiles or cards that match? Good news! Fruit Mix is an exceptional "anti-memory" game: the goal is to find two tiles that do not match! The images have three distinct characteristics so this game requires you to apply not only your memory, but logic as well. To memorize the whole card? Or only some of the characteristics? Maybe it's better to just remember the missing characteristics? Choosing your tactics is the key to success! Get energized with this bold and brainy game!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Have you ever tried to compare the speed of a raindrop with the weight of the world's largest pumpkin or the number of rooms in Buckingham Palace? In the fast-paced trivia game Giraffometer, you don't need to know the right answer! In the world of amazing, astonishing and just plain funny facts that awaits you, just try to correctly guess which facts have the highest and lowest numbers! And may your Giraffometer never fail you!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
In Throne of Elements, you command one of four playful golem tribes. Your goal is to make your tribe dominate the region by sending in more golems to the region. You can win by controlling more than half of the region or wait until end of the competition and see who is left standing.

Throne of Elements is a secret objective card game where you control a certain group of golems and deploy them to wrest control over a small area. When simply deploying your golems is not enough, powerful action cards can be used to relocate other golems or remove them from the competition!

Throne of Elements is fun to play with family and friends. It's easy for children to learn and can be challenging for advanced group of player. Throne of Elements also comes in a compact size, making it easy to carry around in your pocket.

item.description:
Patience and accuracy are needed in a game relative of darts but using water. With a water proof board at your feet, players aim for targets on the board with dippers in hand.
Their are positive, negative, and card spots.
Using a round setting, set the round maximum. Getting 3 drops per round, aim and call out which target you're attempting to hit. The objective is to gain the most positive points at the end of the round. Negatives decrease your points and the card will make you draw, giving you directions on how to drip your next drop. Maybe closing your eyes or dripping behind your back has a benefit? The card has many ways to Drip

Description from the publisher:

With as few cards as possible, try to portray a concept while everyone else tries to guess what it is. Whoever gets it first by calling it out receives points, as does the player who successfully portrayed it.

In more detail, in CardArt the players can use the cards as they like: laying them flat on the table, keep them in upright position, or any position they think are helpful to get the concept across to the table to the other players. You can even move them on the table and in the air. With the person card Luca, for example, it is easier to portray a racecar driver in his car or a parachuter under a slightly bended card. The only limits are with the imagination of the players...

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

One player turns over all the cards as quickly as he can. At the same time, the other players collect as many complete animals (that consist of three parts each) as they can in the given time.

But since the time pressure is high in Nimmit and the parts of the animals look quite similar, players can easily mess it up.

name.value: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star

item.description:
Heroes Against the Red Star is a complete Lock ‘n Load core game which brings the Lock ‘n Load Tactical system to West Germany to Paris , on the first days of World War III.

You’ll command a bucket of 1985-era weaponry including Soviet T-80, T-72, T-64, and T-55 tanks Hind helicopters, Soviet infantry, paratroopers, BMPs, and all their accoutrements of war - RPGs, RPKs, RPDs, you are free to do so. You also forces representing French conscripts, the Foreign Legion, Paratroopers, and lots of tanks. You’ll match AMX30 B-2 tanks against the best Russian armor, direct Jaguar airstrikes, and recon enemy positions with ERC-90 and AMX 10RC armored cars

You get to play with anti-tank guided missiles (ATGM), which are easily depleted, advanced armor, advanced sights (thermal and night), fixed wing air support, and much more.

Fight scenarios from the first probes by Soviet infantry to the ultimate, desperate clash for the Eisenbach Bridge. This is modern street fighting., in the buildings, on the deck of the tanks.

link.value: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Bear and the Jackal
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 4 Modern Era
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Core Rules v5.0
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Days of Villainy
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules

name.value: Von Moltke's Triumph: Fall of the Second Empire, 1870

item.description:
Von Moltke's Triumph recreates the decisive 1870 campaign of the Franco-Prussian War. Under Helmuth von Moltke the Elder, the German states used superior logistics, advanced artillery, and a strategy of envelopment to terrorize the sluggish and unprepared French.

Historically, it ended with the capitulation and capture of Napoleon III after a mere five weeks. The game slants historically but is intended for competitive play: the French will almost always lose the war, but a good French Player can win the game.

Tom Russell's designs tend to have unusual combat or activation mechanisms, but in this game he utilizes a mostly traditional, odds-based CRT and Logistics-Move-Combat sequence of play. A liberal strategic movement rule allows for lightning-fast encirclements, while subtle differences in each side's logistic phase, organizational structure, and the rounding of combat factors reflect the doctrinal and technological differences that proved decisive.

Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals: Loro Parque 1, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Loro Parque 1 includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.

name.value: Czy wiesz, który zwierz...? Kieszonkowa fauna Afryki i Azji

item.description:
Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals: Serengeti-Park Hodenhagen, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Serengeti-Park Hodenhagen includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.

Wildwood is a card game in which two players, or two teams, compete to call Druids and build the most fitting Grove.

Each round you draw three cards. From those cards, you decide which to use as a bid to call a Druid, which to place in your face-down back row for end-game scoring, and which to place in your face-up front row as a source of effects.

The Druids you have successfully called add scoring bonuses, the ability to rearrange your cards and those of your opponents, and other special effects.

At the end of the sixth round, you score your back row. You count the face value of the cards you have placed within it, bonuses granted by the Druids you have called, and you also gain bonus points for suit or number matches you have created.

Team play adds chances to meaningfully cooperate with your teammates, and to read and respond to the other team's gameplay as it unfolds.

A player becomes Kyuubi and travels through the corrupting world. 
While fighting with Beasts, you will gain allies, collect sacred treasures,
and train up your party.
Your goal is to go to the celestial realm, fight against Izanami, 
and win before the world completely perishes.

â–  Objective of the game
When either of the following two are fulfilled, the game ends.

â‘  Victory in decisive battle
Fight against "Izanami," whom the decisive battle board indicates. 
When a player wins the battle,
the game immediately ends and the player will be the winner of the game.

â‘¡ Destruction of the world
At the end of a turn, when 8 land boards are face down,
except for "The Road to celestial realm," the game ends.
The world is destroyed and all players will lose the game.

â–  Game flow
You will repeat destruction phase and travel phase.

1, Destruction phase
A bad beast begins to appear in the peaceful world under the influence of Izanami.
The world where two bad beasts appeared becomes the destruction.

2, travel phase
Start the game from the player with Jewel token, and ao around once clockwise.

â–  Play
â‘  Move
Move your own kyuubi token.

â‘¡ Encounter
If there is a Beast card on your Kyuubi token, you will start a battle.

â‘¢ Effect of land
Execute the land effect, where your Kyuubi token stays.

â–  End of battle and rewards

 Victory




• If you win the battle, you get either of the following two rewards.
â‘  Acquire the enemy card
â‘¡ Acquire experience value

â–  Decisive battle
You will battle against Izanami in a decisive battle. 
Its strength is determined by the position of decisive battle status cubes.

When you win the battle against Izanami, you will be the winner of the game!

â–  Items
â‘  jewel token
A player, who has a jewel, plays the game in journey phase first.

â‘¡ mirror token
A card that has a mirror token placed on it acquires magic attack power value, 
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.

â‘¢ sword token
A card that has a sword token placed on it acquires physical attack power value, 
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.


 Herb


If you use a herb, you can recover up to 3 strengths of any one card of your party.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
You are in the currency exchange market. You will be trading money with other players. 
You will have some possible secret partners. You can find out who your partner is or find out which currency is fake. There will be a secret card that shows the currency or the numbered bill that is fake for that round. Be the player with most money at the end. 
Don't get fooled by the counterfeit bills.

Contents: 
50 cards (1$, 2$, 5$, $10, $20) x 2 of 5 currencies
10 counterfeit round cards (5 money denominations, 5 of the currency)
15 secret player cards (3 of each that represent the 5 currencies)
50 score sheets (or provide your own paper and pencil)
1 starting coin

Set up:
Choose a dealer by drawing from the money cards, highest amount wins. If a ties everyone can draw and add total.
Place the starting coin in front of the dealer. Shuffle and place one counterfeit card in the center. 
Deal one secret player card to each player, put the rest aside.
Deal 5 currency cards to each player. (4-5 players deal 4)

Play:
The person to the right of the dealer will start.
Their first action is to choose one face down card to look at. 
They can look at another player's secret card or the featured counterfeit card in the center of the table.
After the player secretly looks they pass one money card to the player of their choice.
This card will remain face down on the table, not to be confused with the money in the players hands.
play then continues to the next player.
Repeat same action.

Play will continue for 5 full rounds, until everyone has used all the money in their hands.
Once all the money has been played everyone will reveal their secret identity cards.
They will flip over the money they have in front of them.
They will flip the counterfeit card in the center of the table.

Scoring:
Each player scores the amount of money in front of them
They also score the same amount as a person with the same identity
Ex. If player A has $21 and Player C has $9 and both are on the blue team, they both will get $30 for that round.


 Any currency or denomination that matches the counterfeit card in the center is void.


Conclusion:
After the first round, write down each player's score.
Move the dealer coin to the next player.
The money and identity cards will be dealt.
The counterfeit cards remain in the center, once one is used, it is out.

Play continues for 5 rounds or till each player gets to start, your choice. Total up all the rounds, player with the most cash wins.

item.description:
Mr. Richter is a children's game that has a head without features. On players turn, they start the timer, draw a card and quickly try to put the correct features on the face that match the face on the card. If they get all the features on, they can press the button & stop the timer. If they do not, the face explodes, releasing all the features.

The game can be played cooperatively, with players quickly putting on a feature one at a time and the one holding a feature when the face explodes loses.

The game can also be played with each player trying to build the entire face on his turn. If the face explodes, that player is out.

The Wastelanders: 2048 is a lite 4x- (EXplore, EXpand, EXploit and EXterminate) that simulates a Socio-Economic Post-Apocalyptic city using a card draw and hand management system to populate a modular board by laying card tiles called Placements.

The Wastelanders: 2048 is a game exclusively printed by The Game Crafter and was finished May of 2016. A earlier game "The Wastelanders" was scraped and discarded to make way for the redesigned and vastly superior 2048.

Players interact with the city using Wastelanders that are recruited and armed using a card drafting system. Each Wastelander once per turn is allowed one Grid Movement. Each Wastelander represents a single Action Point the player can choose to use on that Wastelanders current placement location.

The list of actions are, Forage, Salvage, Recruit, Assault, and Control. Forage, Salvage, Recruit, and Assault all use Dice Rolls to predict success. Whereas control is Placement specific and is an active or passive bonus earned from Controlling The Area.

The game at its heart is a Player Elimination Game that revolves around a Take That mechanic where player life is represented by Food, and by Wastelanders alive. The game is lost when all Wastelanders have been killed or starved to death the later dealing with major elements of Player Verse Environment.

What is a Socio-Economic Apocalypse? Total social breakdown. Think food riots and fighting in the streets, a world on fire without solution. Major cities collapsing under the weight of anarchy. The Wastelanders is based on a future of food scarcity, a very real Soylent Green is People type of society without any solutions. After, empty husks of cities as the world burns unable to sustain its infrastructure or itself any longer.

Each copy of the game comes with

54 Placement Cards
36 Recruitment Cards
36 Event Cards
96 Item Cards
32 Card Stands of 4 Different Colors
1 D-6
1 D-20

And 20 Ammo Tokens, 38 Famine Tokens, 50 Food Tokens

item.description:
Xoliba is a fast-paced, surprising and totally new abstract strategy game. It has no standard starting position. Instead, before each game a new starting position is created by placing game pieces on the board at random. As there are billions of possible starting positions, each game is different from the next. Because the starting position is randomized, it seldom offers equal opportunities for both players and you may well need luck to win. Sometimes you can find yourself much worse off from the very beginning; in such positions all what you can do is to minimize your loss. Do not get discouraged: Xoliba is played in matches and the next game might well be yours.

The objective of the game is to create triangles. The game is won by the player who has the biggest triangle on the board when the game ends. Moves are made by changing places of the player's own piece and a neutral white piece in such a manner that a new triangle is formed. If such a triangle contains player's own or opponent's pieces, they are captured. The game ends when no new triangles can be formed. The winner scores points from enemy pieces that have been captured. The match is won by the player who is the first to reach or exceed 50 points. Of course, it is not obligatory to play up to 50 points. If the players so wish, they can also play shorter or longer matches, for example, up to 35 points.

Equipment

7x7 octagonal board with 45 intersections (corners cut off), points, where horizontal, oblique, and vertical lines cross each other. Game pieces are 57 discs. Each disc has a white side but the colour of the opposite side varies: in 17 discs it is red, in 17 discs it is blue, in 12 it is green and in 11 it is white.

item.description:
Ascension is a deck-building game in which players spend Runes to acquire more powerful cards for their deck. It offers a dynamic play experience where players have to react and adjust their strategy accordingly. Each player starts with a small deck of cards, and uses those cards to acquire more and better cards for their deck, with the goal of earning the most Honor Points by gaining cards and defeating monsters.

Ascension: Dreamscape is the ninth standalone game in the Ascension series, although the game can be combined with other titles for play with up to six players. This set introduces the Insight resource that allows players to acquire exclusive Dream cards. Player can also use the Dreamscape to access powerful new Vision cards as well as Heroes and Contructs.

item.description:
The purpose of Trafik is to teach primarily children age 6-14 how to travel safely through traffic.

Each player or team (of up to 2 players) gets a car that is moved around the board through dice rolls. If the player lands on a blue square he rolls again.

Other squares require the player to answer a question about traffic to proceed. The questions are divided into 3 age-appropriate difficulties: 6-12 years, 12-18 years and 18 years and above. There are 2 questions in each difficulty on each of the 90 playing cards. Which one is used is decided by whether the dice roll was even or uneven. On a correct answer you get to go again - a wrong answer ends your turn.

Finally there are squares that move you further on the board or ends your turn.

Each time a player crosses start he is awarded a traffic-sign. The first player to collect 4 wins.

This is a dice game that comes with 6 dice in a cup that can be used to throw the dice.

At the beginning of your turn you must throw all dice. Then you have to set aside at least one winning combination. If you have 350 points or more you can retire, if not you must continue with the rest of the dice. If after a throw you are unable to set aside at least one die you lose the points of the round.

There are only 10 winning combinations that let you win between 50 and 1000 points.

When a player reaches 5000 points the game will end after everyone has the same amounts of rounds.

This is a mix of several South America games like “El Ambicioso”, “Generala”, “El Juego de los Diez Mil" and “Farkle”

This game challenges kids and parents with more than 200 trivia questions.
Play the game to get some great advice!

Each question has a "BEEP-ed" word: the players take turns trying to find the missing word. The first player answering five correct questions wins the game.

There are special cards where players should provide an ingredient of their choice to add in a given recipe and then, the Chef in charge for that turn will choose the winner based on his own taste.

The game also features some variants as the simultaneous possibility to answer: you need to be the first to catch an item in order to get the right to answer!

The game presents four different levels of difficulty: at the beginning of the game, the players may choose to play a specific level or a mix of all four.

This game challenges players with more than 200 trivia questions about wine! 
Play the game to get some great advice and achieve the knowledge of a sommelier!

Each question has a "BEEP-ed" word: the players take turns trying to find the missing word. 
The first player answering five correct questions wins the game.

Some cards present a different challenge: simultaneous answer, or a greatest prize consisting in stealing a point from another player in addition to the normal prize for the correct answer.

The game presents four different levels of difficulty: at the beginning of the game, the players may choose to play a specific level or a mix of all four.

name.value: Baiting the Bear: The 1942 Soviet Kharkov Offensive

item.description:
Baiting the Bear: The 1942 Soviet Kharkov Offensive, depicts the May 1942 offensive by Soviet forces under the command of Marshal Semyon Timoshenko against the German 6th Army. After initial promising signs, the offensive was stopped by German counterattacks. Critical errors by several staff officers and by Joseph Stalin, who failed to accurately estimate the 6th Army's potential and overestimated their own newly trained forces, led to a German pincer attack which cut off advancing Soviet troops from the rest of the front. The operation caused almost 300,000 Soviet casualties compared to just 20,000 for the Germans and their allies.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 4 miles / 6.4 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Army

Game Inventory:
Two 11x17" full color map
Two dual-side printed un-mounted countersheet (260 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 6-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart
Eight pages of 64 Event Cards

Player Provided: One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours

link.value: Springing the Trap: Operation Fredericus, May 1942

item.description:
Wizard School is like normal school, except it's a card game where you have to carefully manage your abilities and resources to make sure that you don't flunk out of the most prosaic magical academy in all the world.

Wizard School is a cooperative card game in which 2-5 players take turns at passing tests, besting monsters in the most epic group project of all time. And yes, you are graded cumulatively. When one of you fails, you all flunk out.

Difficulty and length of games can be managed by choosing from among 20 different graduation cards, which helps ensure that each game is a new experience.

Your goal may be to graduate, but you can’t let the monsters overrun the school. As they pile up, you’re forced to use your magic just to stay alive, and you may have nothing left to pass the Graduation Milestones. If you reach an F (on the Graduation Card), it’s Game Over.

item.description: Taxi Challenge! Who is the fastest cab driver and who gets $100 first during a work shift. Face difference challenges during your shift and you may get a big reward for a job well done. Its own excitement to the game comes with occurrence cards and tactical cards. Roll a die and move your pawn to nearest taxi bollard to find your next customer.

After countless battles, the King and Queen have grown worried of the strength of their army and thus have issued a decree for their soldiers to train more! Together, a Rook and Bishop practice their combat skills in Red Rook Blue Bishop.

Red Rook Blue Bishop is a micro abstract game that can fit 1 or more players, though 1-4P is recommended as the board is relatively small. The components are minimal, the gameplay is simple, and players may jump in and out at their leisure.

The gameplay takes inspiration from both Ricochet Robots and the movements of a Rook and Bishop in Chess. The goal is to be the first player to reach 3 points, and a point is rewarded every time a player successfully points out a path to the target.

Battle for Kirovograd is a simulation of the battles in January 1944 between the German 8th Army and the Soviet 2nd Ukrainian Front. The battle took place in freezing, often blizzard conditions, around the city of Kirovograd. While the Soviets were able to capture the city, both sides fought themselves to a standstill with extremely high losses due to combat and extreme weather.

Each turn of Battle for Kirovograd equals 1 day. One hex equals 2 miles. Unit counters represent battalions, regiments, brigades and divisions. The game lasts for 12 Turns.

You and your fellow fishermen are having a whale of a time on the high seas. The fish are literally jumping into your boats. So many fish are landing on deck that your boats are beginning to overload and capsize. The only way to tackle this fishy situation is to release all of the fish you've caught before you take a trip to Davy Jones' locker. The winner is the first fisherman to release all of their fish. Good luck and let cod be with you!

Each turn in No Fish!, players guess a number or special fish type. If they guess correctly, they release all of those fish from their hand and may take a special action; if they guess incorrectly, the other players call "No Fish!" and that player has to draw a card from the fish deck. The special action fish — Starfish, Toadfish, Flyingfish, Lionfish and Monkfish — are what separates this game from a generic number-guessing game to a game of strategy, bluffing and manipulation.

Each pack contains 54 cards: four types of basic fish (Goldfish, Dogfish, Rainbowfish and Clownfish) numbered 1-10, five types of special fish (Starfish, Toadfish, Flyingfish, Lionfish (three copies of each) and Monkfish (two copies)).

item.description:
Jomsborg is freely based on an ancient viking game.

The game board is made to symbolise the viking stronghold Jomsborg and the game is centred around the struggle between Harald Bluetooth (Harald Blåtand) and his son Sweyn Forkbeard (Svend Tveskæg). The player playing Sweyn starts at the center of the board with 1 king and 28 vikings. Harald starts as an outer rim on the board with 1 king and 47 vikings.

The players take turn moving one piece at a time. Pieces are moved horizontally or vertically - never diagonally - on the board. Vikings can move as many or few spaces as they want in one direction without crossing other pieces. Kings can only move one space at a time.

Kings can only be beaten by a king moving to the same space. Vikings can be beaten by having enemy pieces on 2 opposite sides of it. Beaten pieces are removed from play. A piece is captured if it is surrounded by pieces on all 4 sides and at least one of these are an enemy piece.

Sweyn wins by having his king reach the outer rim of the board or by capturing or beating Harald. Harald wins by capturing Sweyn or by beating him.

You’ve been given a unique opportunity to become a head of the magnificent city of Urbis. There is always a plenty of those who are eager to take this place, so when such a chance comes up, they’re ready to take it by all means.

The city of Urbis is ruled by the City Council elected by the residents. The main objective of the game is to become the Head of the Council. Like all the other players, you are a Council member who is responsible for the well-being and prosperity of the city. Each Council member (player) has an access to the city treasury and guard, and is obliged to follow the Council’s decreets. Each councillor is in charge of one of the city blocks (represented by a board given to each player in the beginning of the game) and aspires to develop his block either quickly or proficiently. Gold and silver from the treasury are distributed depending on the buildings that have been put up on the block. However the block residents are always on the lookout: no one wants to live close to the cemetery, gibbet or prison. Take thought for the residents, spend some money, and these grim buildings will appear on the neighbour’s block instead of your own. Hospital is also an essential city institution but it demands substantial charges to maintain. Taking this into account a player might awaken his inner dictator and build up his block with slums and honky-tonks, regardless of the residents’ needs, because the first player to fill all the building slots on his block becomes a winner. Which way is the best? To consider the block residents or to just execute the will of the Council? To turn your block into a dark place or a blooming garden? In Urbis you’ll have to make decisions promptly.

name.value: Rising 5: Runes of Asteros 解密特攻
Rising 5: Runes of Asteros 解密特攻 (Chinese Version)

item.description:
Find the lost runes and save the planet Asteros!

A long, long time ago, the ancient King of Asteros confined the brutal monsters in the Rune Gate and sealed it with four divine runes. But five days ago, a mysterious evil power opened the gate and changed the code. Asteros is haunted by fear and disasters again! The wise leader ORAKL asked the Council of United Planets and they sent four famous agents: EKHO, HAL, ELLI and NOVA. ORAKL the wise and the four brave agents begin to fight against the evil powers to save Asteros. They must find the Code to reset the Gate and confine the monsters again. People call them "Rising 5", hoping they will be able to restore peace on the planet.

Rising 5: Runes of Asteros is a co-operative deduction and adventure game with a mobile phone application or a game master. Players must find the answer Code with the four Runes in the right arrangement before the evil power devours the planet. Players can explore the planet to collect energy or clues and to fight against evil monsters. When players try to unlock the code, the App or the game master will give signs that lead to right code.

If players successfully find the code, they win; if the Darkness Level reaches the Red Moon because of the evil monsters or if the Character card deck is exhausted, the players lose the game.
